III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff physically push youth out of the cabin at the facility and
throw youth's belongings out as well. Youth was upset and
required assistance to maintain safety and staff could be heard
laughing in the background.
Investigation A complaint was received on 3/1/23 stating Youth A called for
assistance because the staff are going to kick her out. They will
shove her, push her, do anything they need to do to get her out of
the house. They will throw all of her belongings outside. Youth A
requested immediate assistance and was very upset on the
phone. Staff were heard talking to her and laughing in the
background. It is unknown what staff were involved. It was
requested to speak to an adult in the home, but no one would get
on the phone. Youth A reported feeling unsafe and needed
immediate help, including police officers. As the situation was
unable to be assessed, Youth A was informed if she needed
immediate emergency assistance and felt unsafe, then she should
call 911. Youth A ended the phone call indicating that was what
she planned to do.
Interviews:
The agency’s assigned consultant was contacted via telephone on
3/1/23. She reported she was at the facility during the incident with
Youth A on 2/28/23. She saw Youth A drag her clothes outside to
the driveway and was acting like she was caring for a baby. She
did not have a coat or shoes on. She reported this youth often
wants attention from the police or ambulance. EMS arrived and
took her to the hospital to be evaluated.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/1/23. She
reported that the facility was trying to put her into an unsafe
situation by moving her to Unit 3. She was previously attacked by
Youth B from Unit 3 and was afraid of what would happen if she
went to Unit 3. She stated the staff were making her move units
because Prison Rape Elimination Act (PREA) complaints were
filed against her. She reported other youth came by the bathroom
while she was naked. Yesterday she was trying to sleep in the
parking lot. She took her belongings and went to sit in the parking
lot. The staff then called an ambulance and she had to go to the
hospital, but she was not a danger to herself. She reported she is
now on a safety plan so she cannot have her coat and shoes. She
said a safety plan is seen as a punishment. Youth A stated the
day Youth B attacked her, Youth B grabbed her hair and hit her
while staff stood by and did nothing.
2

Youth A's case manager (CM) was interviewed face to face at the
facility on 3/1/23. She reported yesterday Youth A refused to
move to the other unit. Youth A needs to move due to Youth A
undressing in front of the other youth on her previous unit. Youth
A does not want to move to Unit 3 because she had problems with
2 of the girls on that unit. One youth was physical with her and the
other girl Youth A wants to fight but nothing physical has occurred.
All three girls go to school together and have no problems. The
staff are on top of the behaviors. There are no safety concerns
with Youth A moving to Unit 3. Yesterday Youth A took her items
to the parking lot and while she was out there, she had put several
layers of clothing on. She also took her bedding with her.
The Program Manager (PM) was interviewed face to face at the
facility on 3/1/23. She reported Youth A needed to move from Unit
4 to Unit 3 due to sexual harassment allegations against Youth A.
PM went down to the unit to talk to Youth A, but Youth A refused
to move to Unit 3. Youth A walked away from her group. After
making a few phone calls to her worker, Central Intake, and 911
Youth A went back to Unit 4. Youth A then grabbed her
belongings and went out to the parking lot. They talked to her for a
while then called an ambulance due to concerns of hypothermia
and wanting her to be evaluated. PM was not at the facility when
Youth A had problems with Youth B. She does not have any
safety concerns about Youth A being on Unit 3 with Youth B.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/1/23.
Youth B reported if the girls get into a fight the staff break it up.
She admitted she fought with Youth A. Youth A pushed up on
Youth B, so Youth B hit her. Staff broke it up right away and
separated the two girls. There has never been a time when staff
did not intervene in a fight.
Documents Reviewed:
 Incident Report for incident with Youth A and Youth B: An
incident report could not be located for the fight between
Youth A and Youth B.
 2/28/23 Incident Report stated Youth A was told she had to
move units and she became upset. She was refusing to
move or pack her belongings. She sat on her bed and
stated no one can physically move her and she was staying
there so no one moved her things. She then went for a
walk with PM and came back. At dinner she didn't want to
move but PM and CM both promised no one would touch
her things. After talking to her worker, she then called CI
who told her to call the police. She then was taken to get
3

her personal things. She packed up personals and her
bedding and said she was going to sleep outside. She
walked out the door with Staff following and talking to her.
She went to the parking lot, threw her bedding on the
ground and spread it out saying she is not going to unit 3
and she will be good outside.
 Youth A case file: Youth A was admitted to the facility on
11/4/22. Since being admitted she has had multiple
incidents involving self-harm, running from the group,
taking her clothes off in front of others, and destruction of
property. She has a history of being assaultive toward
adults.
Analysis There is no indication that a rule or policy was violated as Youth A
stated she moved her belongings out into the parking lot on her
own.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff members physically push youth out of the cabin at the
facility.
Investigation A complaint was received on 3/1/23 that included Youth A called
for assistance because the staff are going to kick her out. They
will shove her, push her, do anything they need to do to get her
out of the house.
During Youth A's interview on 3/1/23 she reported the staff did not
push her out of the cabin, but she walked out on her own. This
information was confirmed by the Case Manager and Program
Manager during their interviews on 3/1/23.
Analysis There is no rule violation as Youth A stated she walked out of the
cabin on her own. The staff did not push her.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
